sn4.8:1.2: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.
sn4.8:1.3: Then Māra the Evil One approached the Blessed One and recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn4.8:2.1: “One who has sons delights in sons,
sn4.8:2.2: One with cattle delights in cattle.
sn4.8:2.3: Acquisitions truly are a man’s delight;
sn4.8:2.4: Without acquisitions one does not delight. ”
sn4.8:3.1: “One who has sons sorrows over sons,
sn4.8:3.2: One with cattle sorrows over cattle.
sn4.8:3.3: Acquisitions truly are a man’s sorrow;
sn4.8:3.4: Without acquisitions one does not sorrow. ”
sn4.8:4.1: Then Māra the Evil One … disappeared right there.
